name: Draft genome sequences of eight Vibrio sp. clinical isolates from across the United States that forms a basal sister clade to Vibrio cholerae

description: We sequenced the genomes of eight isolates from various regions of the United States that show high sequence similarity to Vibrio sp. 2521-89, a recently reported genome(1). These isolates form a monophyletic cluster clearly related but distinct from V. cholerae, representing a highly divergent basal lineage or a potential novel species.

citation.text: Draft genome sequences of eight Vibrio sp. clinical isolates from across the United States that forms a basal sister clade to Vibrio cholerae. Liang K et al 2018. MRA submitted.

distribution.name: Vibrio_metaData.xlsx
distribution.description: Average Nucleotide Identity (ANI) and in-silico DNA-DNA Hybridization (isDDH) for all pairwise comparisons between representative Vibrio cholerae strains and the eight isolates.

distribution.name: Vibrio_sp_1000BTS_MLtree.pdf
distribution.description: 1000 bootstrap maximum likelihood tree with the eight isolates and representative Vibrio cholerae strains

distribution.name: Vibrio_sp_100BTS_tree.pdf
distribution.description: 100 bootstrap tree. Vibrio sp ML tree created with RaxML. Includes representatives Vibrio cholerae strains and the eight additional isolates
